Cedar Creek Teaching Family Home

Marquette, MI 49855-8948
Dear Mr. Hogue:
Your Child Care Institution license is renewed. It is valid only at your present address
and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the license in the mail. Please review it for accuracy.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.
Sincerely,
Holly K. Austin, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are no additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are no additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not
be included in section 1.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require any technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require any consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
A corrective action plan was approved on 8/20/2020 after the facility was cited
for R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training due to the
facility chief administrator failing to obtain approval in writing for the physical
management training curriculum. The facility changed the curriculum and did
not make the request to the assigned consultant, therefore did not have
approval in writing from November 2, 2018 until May 7, 2020. As of May 7, 2020,
the facility came into compliance with this rule.
A physical inspection of the home and an interview of the Chief Administrator was
completed 10/12/2020. No concerns were noted. There were no new placements
made at the program during the period under review and there are no staff currently
employed by the facility. As such, the only documentation that was reviewed for this
inspection were two closed resident files and six restraints.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, contract, and policy. It is recommended that
the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
November 11, 2020
________________________________________
Holly K. Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 12, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
